pullrequest.title: Tutorial on how Ignition finds resources at runtime

content.raw:
> Do you have any examples you could point us to? I'm only very familiar with the way resources are looked up in the ROS / Gazebo ecosystem, where I believe paths like those would usually come from environment variables like `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`.

For Qt, the plugins are found by default in `QTDIR/plugins` , where `QTDIR` is the installation prefix of Qt \(see [https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/deployment-plugins.html](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/deployment-plugins.html)\), so `.deb` packages typically install them there so they are automatically found, see for example [https://packages.debian.org/sid/amd64/dde-qt5integration/filelist](https://packages.debian.org/sid/amd64/dde-qt5integration/filelist) .
